english: "When I asked to go out drinking with some friends, did you not say that it was fine? So why are you so angry? You're contradicting yourself." "Not at all! english: Yanni testified.

japanese: 「きなちゃん」はうちの猫の愛称だ。
english: "Kina-chan" is our cat's nickname.

japanese: 電車とホームの間が広く空いているところがございますので、足元にご注意ください。
english: There's a wide gap between the train and the platform, so please watch your step.

japanese: スペイン語は、毎日勉強してるよ。
english: I study Spanish every day.

japanese: 僕のじいちゃんは、週末になるとビールを飲んでたなぁ。
english: My grandfather used to drink beer on the weekends.

japanese: このシャツ着てみて。
english: Try on this shirt.

japanese: 彼ね、授業サボったのよ。
english: He skipped the class.

japanese: 果物としての金柑は食べたことないんだけどさ、金柑味の飴ならよく買ってるよ。
english: I haven't ever eaten kumquat as a fruit, but I often buy it as a hard candy flavour.

japanese: あの引き出しの中は雑多なもので溢れかえっている。
english: That drawer is full of miscellaneous items.

japanese: 今日は後ろの席に座ったよ。
english: I sat in the back today.

japanese: アンナは壁の方を向き、数を数え始めました。「1・２・３・４・５・６・７・８・９・１０。隠れていようがいまいが、行くからね！」そう言うとアンナは、数を数える間に隠れた友達を、さがし始めました。
english: Anna turned her face to the wall and began to count: "One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten. Ready or not, here I come!" Then she started searching for her friends, who had hidden themselves in the meantime.

japanese: バクテリアは微生物だ。
english: Bacteria are microorganisms.

japanese: 花子は壁に顔を伏せ、数を数え始めました。「いーち、にー、さーん、しー、ごー、ろーく、ひーち、はーち、きゅー、じゅ。もういいかい？」「まぁだだよ」「もういいかい？」「もういいよ」それを聞いて花子は、数を数えている間に隠れた友達を、さがし始めました。
english: Hanako turned her head towards the wall and began counting: "O—ne, Two—, Three—, Four—, Five—, Six—, Se—ven, Eight—, Nine—, Ten. Ready?" "Not yet." "Ready now?" "Ready." She then began to look for her friends who had hidden themselves in the meantime.

japanese: メアリーは花屋で働いてるよ。
english: Mary works in a flower shop.

japanese: メアリーはお花屋さんで働いてるのよ。
english: Mary works in a flower shop.

japanese: 桃子は、おはじきを「一つ、二つ、三つ、四つ、五つ、六つ、七つ、八つ、九つ、十」まで数えると黙り込んでしまいました。お母さんが「十一、十二、十三」と続けると嬉しそうに「十四、十五、十六」と数え続けました。
english: Momoko counted the marbles: "One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten" and then went silent. When her mother continued with "eleven, twelve, thirteen," she happily picked up with "fourteen, fifteen, sixteen."

japanese: 私は１９８７年２月１３日に生まれました。
english: I was born on February 13, 1987.

japanese: トムはブーメランを投げたが、戻ってはこなかった。
english: Tom threw the boomerang, but it didn't come back.

japanese: 私だったら、安い方を買うな。
english: If it were me, I'd buy the cheaper one.

japanese: 窓が開けっぱなしだったわよ。
english: You left the window open.

japanese: そんなに食べないの！
english: Don't eat so much!

japanese: 今何を見たの？
english: What did you just see?

japanese: 日曜は営業していますか？
english: Is it open on Sundays?

japanese: メアリーは、他の同い年の女の子とは違うんだよ。
english: Mary isn't like other girls her age.

japanese: 犬は私を見ると、尻尾を振った。
english: When the dog saw me, it wagged its tail.

japanese: 友達みんなに連絡しました。
english: I contacted all my friends.

japanese: ガリレオって、あなたの本名？
english: Is Galileo your real name?

japanese: それは、病気じゃないよ。
english: That is not an illness.

japanese: うまく説明できないんだけど。
english: I can't really explain it well.

japanese: うまく説明できない。
english: I can't really explain it well.

japanese: 私たちは美味しいチェリーを食べますよ。
english: We will eat a delicious cherry.

japanese: この扉は強化ガラスでできています。
english: The door is made of tempered glass.

japanese: ご近所さんのとこにはザクロの木があるのよ。
english: My neighbors have a pomegranate tree.

japanese: 心配しないで。覚えとくよ。
english: Don't worry. I'll remember.

japanese: 心配はいらないよ。覚えとくから。
english: Don't worry. I'll remember.

japanese: 私ね、恋愛運がないのよ。
english: I'm unlucky in love.

japanese: あなたの携帯ってさ、ゲーム入ってる？
english: Do you have any games on your phone?

japanese: お前のスマホ、ゲーム入ってんの？
english: Do you have any games on your phone?

japanese: また見てはいけないものを見てしまった。
english: Unfortunately I saw things I should not see again.

japanese: 今日は一日中歩き回ってたから、もう足が棒だよ。
english: I've been walking around all day today, and my legs are killing me.

japanese: 青い服を着ると、すごく引き立つね。
english: You're very attractive in blue.

japanese: ケーキはもう食べたでしょ。
english: You've already eaten the cake.

japanese: 歌を続ければよかったんだよ。
english: You should've gone on singing.

japanese: 今に見てなさい！思い知らしてやる！
english: Now look here! I will give you such a piece of my mind!

japanese: パパとママを捜すのを手伝ってくれない？お願い。
english: Can you help me find my parents, please?

japanese: お願いです。両親を探すのを手伝ってくれませんか？
english: Can you help me find my parents, please?

japanese: えぇ、私が加入している保険にはレッカーサービスが付いています。
english: Yes, my insurance covers tow service.

japanese: ヤニーはスクーラーが嫌いだったの。
english: Yanni didn't like Skura.

japanese: ヤニーはスクーラーが好きじゃなかったのよ。
english: Yanni didn't like Skura.

japanese: たった今、行ったところよ。
english: He just went a moment ago.

japanese: 日本ってどう思う？
english: What do you think about Japan?

japanese: お肉、うまそう。
english: The meat looks good.

japanese: 私がどこにいるかわかる？
english: Do you know where I am?

japanese: 生きるためにはお金がいります。
english: We need money to live.

japanese: 生活するにはお金が必要です。
english: We need money to live.

japanese: 胸がドキドキするよ。
english: My heart beats faster.

japanese: 彼とスキーに行くつもりなの。
english: I plan to go ski with him.

japanese: いくら走ったって、間に合わないって。
english: No matter how much you run, you'll never make it on time.

japanese: メアリーがそんなことすると思う？
english: Do you think Mary would do something like that?

japanese: 富士山にかかる笠雲は縁起がいいと言われています。
english: The cap cloud above Mt. Fuji is said to be a good omen.

japanese: フランスでピニャコラーダの香りがする石鹸を買ったんだ。
english: I bought a soap in France that smells like piña colada.

english: I found a stone that has the shape of a heart.

japanese: 名前を書いてください。
english: Please write your name.

japanese: ここで降ろしてください。
english: Please drop me off here.

japanese: 日本食を食べたのって初めてなの？
english: Is this the first time you've tried Japanese food?

japanese: 和食を食べたのって、これが初めて？

english: Health is a precious treasure.

english: Did you fasten your seatbelt?

japanese: シートベルトはした？
english: Did you fasten your seatbelt?

japanese: それは全く関係ないよ。
english: That's all beside the point.

japanese: このバスって動物園で止まりますか？
english: Does this bus stop at the zoo?

japanese: あなたって、いつも仕事に追われてるのね。
english: You're always as busy as a bee.

japanese: 「どこ行くの？」「お前の弟を迎えに行くんだよ」
english: "Where are you going?" "I'm going to pick up your brother."

english: I haven't received a reply yet.

japanese: こんなシャツは買いたくないよ。
english: I don't want to buy this shirt.

japanese: その曲、聴いてみて。
english: Listen to the song.

japanese: もうすぐ終わるよ。
english: He'll finish in a second.

japanese: 待っててくれるかな。
english: I hope he waits for me.

japanese: トムとメアリーが結婚するって本当ですか？

japanese: クリスマスの朝は、子供たちはハイテンションです。
english: The children are giddy with excitement on Christmas morning.

japanese: クリスマスの朝って、子供たちワクワクしてはしゃいじゃうのよね。
english: The children are giddy with excitement on Christmas morning.

japanese: なくしてた鍵を見つけたよ。
english: I found the keys that I'd lost.

japanese: 失くしてた鍵があったの。
english: I found the keys I'd lost.

japanese: 日本語の漢字には複数の読み方があります。
english: Kanji have multiple pronunciations in Japanese.

japanese: 少し変わった質問だろうけど、とりあえず聞いてみよう。
english: I know it's a bit of a strange question, but I'll ask it anyway.

japanese: ごめんね。私の説明が悪かったわ。
english: Sorry. I explained it badly.

japanese: 彼女の冗談に、トムったら笑ったのよ。
english: Tom laughed at her joke.

japanese: トムね、彼女のジョークに笑ったんだ。
english: Tom laughed at her joke.

japanese: 銀杏は生きた化石です。
english: The gingko is a living fossil.

japanese: 銀杏は大きな木だよ。
english: Ginkgos are large trees.

japanese: イチョウは大木です。
english: Ginkgos are large trees.

japanese: すみません。もう一杯ビールをお願いします。
english: Excuse me. Another beer, please.

japanese: 当然のことを言ったまでよ。
english: I only stated the obvious.

japanese: それを読むのって、時間の無駄だった。
english: Reading it was a waste of time for me.

japanese: この自転車、僕のに似てる。
english: This bike is similar to mine.

japanese: この自転車、私のみたい。
english: This bicycle looks like mine.

japanese: 緊張しすぎて食べ物が喉を通らないんだ。
english: I'm too nervous to eat anything.

japanese: 水泳が一番好きなスポーツなんだ。
english: Swimming is my favorite sport.

japanese: 私立の学校は公立よりいいんだって。それって本当？
english: They say that private schools are better than public ones. Is that true?

japanese: 公立校より私立の方が優秀なんだってさ。本当なの？
english: They say that private schools are better than public ones. Is that true?

japanese: 怒らないって約束してくれるなら話すよ。
english: I'll tell you if you promise me you won't get mad.

japanese: 韓国に住んでる友達に会いに行くんだ。
english: I'm going to visit a friend living in South Korea.

japanese: 韓国に住んでる友達のところに行ってくる。
english: I'm going to visit a friend living in South Korea.

japanese: 韓国の友達のところに行ってきます。
english: I'm going to visit a friend who lives in South Korea.

japanese: 天国と地獄って本当にあるの？
english: Do heaven and hell actually exist?

japanese: 風邪が治らないよ。
english: My cold isn't getting any better.

japanese: もちろん僕もやるよ！
english: I'll do it too, of course!

japanese: 語順が同じ言語は勉強し易いです。
english: It's easy to study languages that have the same word order.

japanese: あの人たちは僕を知らない。
english: Those people don't know me.

japanese: どうせ言っても分からないじゃん。
english: Even if I said it, you wouldn't understand it anyway.

japanese: 子供たちは公園で遊んでるよ。
english: The children are playing in the park.

japanese: 誰か、この文を消してください。
english: Someone please delete this sentence.

japanese: 語学の家庭教師をしてるんだ。
english: I'm a private language teacher.

japanese: リック、教えてくれてありがとう。
english: Thanks for letting me know, Ryck.

japanese: 旅行がすごく好きなの。
english: I really like to travel.

japanese: 今、仕事してるよ。
english: I'm working now.

japanese: 今、仕事中だよ。
english: I'm working now.

japanese: 愛してるよって言ったら、信じてくれる？
english: Would you believe me if I told you that I love you?

japanese: 大好きだよって言ったら、信じてくれる？
english: Would you believe me if I told you that I love you?

japanese: トムの親父ギャグについつい笑ってしまった。
english: I couldn't help but let out a chuckle at Tom's cheesy joke.

japanese: 節約中です。
english: I'm saving money.

japanese: お金を貯めてるの。
english: I'm saving money.

japanese: 先生が言ったことが、ちんぷんかんぷん。
english: I didn't understand what the teacher said.

japanese: 今日は涼しい雨の日です。
english: Today is a cool, rainy day.

japanese: 他のところには行けなかったよ。
english: I couldn't go anywhere else.

japanese: カメラは常に持ち歩いています。
english: My camera goes wherever I go.

japanese: 待合室には、誰もいませんでした。
english: The waiting room was completely empty.

japanese: 君の家は誰が建てたの？
english: Who built your house?

japanese: 年末までに30件の家を建てることが目標です。
english: Our goal is to build thirty houses before the end of the year.

japanese: トムとメアリーは外で雪だるまを作っている。
english: Tom and Mary are outside building a snowman.

japanese: ここ3年はこのあたりに新しい建物がたくさん建っている。
english: A lot of new buildings have been built around here in the last three years.

japanese: その橋の建設には３年近くかかりました。
english: That bridge took nearly three years to build.

japanese: 彼らはこの図書館を2013年に建てました。
english: They built this library in 2013.

japanese: どんなボートを作りたいの？
english: What kind of boat do you want to build?

japanese: 誰かがそれを支払わなければいけない。
english: Someone has to pay for it.

english: I set my alarm to go off at 2:30.

japanese: タイマーはもうセットされてるよ。
english: The timer has already been set.

japanese: よくお昼寝するの？
english: Do you often take afternoon naps?

japanese: バスで旅行するのと電車で旅行するの、どっちの方がいい？
english: Do you prefer to travel by bus or by train?

japanese: トムは高所恐怖症じゃない。
english: Tom isn't afraid of heights.

japanese: 君が欲しいものは持ってないよ。
english: I don't have what you want.

japanese: えげつないやり方だったな。
english: It was a nasty trick.

japanese: たちの悪いいたずらでした。
english: It was a nasty prank.

japanese: 悪質な嫌がらせでした。
english: It was a nasty prank.

japanese: ここはすごく安心感を覚えるわ。
english: We feel very safe here.

japanese: ここはとても安全そう。
english: We feel very safe here.

japanese: 汚いやり方だったわね。
english: It was a dirty trick.

japanese: 卑劣な手口だったよな。
english: It was a dirty trick.

japanese: 私たちドイツに行くのよ。
english: We're going to Germany.

japanese: うちの猫ね、私がフランス語を話すと嫌がるのよ。
english: My cat doesn't like it when I speak French.

japanese: トムは友達の間に座ってます。
english: Tom is sitting between his friends.

japanese: 大人になったら、車掌になりたい。
english: When I grow up, I want to be a train conductor.

japanese: イスの上に猫が座ってるよ。
english: There's a cat sitting on the chair.

japanese: 子猫ちゃん、かわいい。
english: Kittens are cute.

japanese: メールに時々、ニコちゃんマークを使うよ。
english: I sometimes use smileys in emails.

japanese: 時として、メールでスマイルマークを使ったりするよ。
english: I sometimes use smileys in emails.

japanese: ビジネスメールに絵文字を使うなんて絶対にしないよ。
english: I would never use emojis in business emails.

japanese: 私はビジネスメールに絵文字は使いません。
english: I would never use emojis in business emails.

japanese: 顔文字と絵文字の違いを知ってる？
english: Do you know what the difference between an emoticon and an emoji is?

japanese: トムはメアリがまだ眠っているかどうかわからなかった。
english: Tom didn't know whether Mary was still asleep or not.

japanese: 赤ちゃんって、かわいい。
english: Babies are cute.

japanese: トムはボストンで、メアリーはシカゴに住んでるよ。
english: Tom lives in Boston, and Mary lives in Chicago.

japanese: トムはボストンで、メアリーはシカゴで暮らしてるよ。
english: Tom lives in Boston, and Mary lives in Chicago.

japanese: 兄にケモナーであることがバレました。
english: My brother found out that I'm a furry.

japanese: なんと兄もケモナーだったのよ。
english: My brother was a furry, too.

japanese: 雨雲のようだね。
english: Those look like rain clouds.

japanese: コーヒーが少し残ってるよ。
english: There's a little coffee left.

japanese: 日なたに座ってるけど、まだ寒いなぁ。
english: I'm sitting in the sun, but I'm still cold.

japanese: 私もめっちゃ日本語が習いたいの。
english: I really want to learn Japanese too.
